chapter.title: The ProjectOptions Plugin
chapter.para: ProjectOptions is a plugin that allows users set options that are generally defined globally in jEdit on a per-project basis. It takes care of changing the options depending on which project is currently active, and restoring the original values when projects are deactivated.
Currently there's support for a limited subset of the available options. These are:

listitem.para: Editing options: most options available in the "Editing" option pane in the jEdit "Global Options" dialog.
WhiteSpacePlugin options: it's possible to configure the "on save" actions of the WhiteSpacePlugin on a per-project basis.

chapter.para: To choose project-specific options, open the project options dialog using ProjectViewer, and make sure you check "Use Custom Options" under "Project Options -> Main".

The project-specific options will apply to all buffers while that project is active. The plugin is able to manage several views, keeping the options synchronized with the active project on the current view. This might cause some delay when changing between views.
